intro: Stigmatodactylus tenuilabris, commonly known as the slender-lipped stigmatodactyl, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers with a distinctive labellum that is narrow and elongated. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
